meanings.sent1: The criminal felt great ignominy when his actions were revealed to the public.
meanings.sent2: The politician's ignominy was evident when his corruption scandal made headlines.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ignominy at being caught stealing treats was written all over its guilty face.
meanings.sent4: The ignominy of losing the championship game haunted the team for years to come.
meanings.sent5: The ignominy of failing the test in front of the whole class was a memory that stuck with him forever.

meanings.definition: Disgraceful or dishonorable quality or conduct.
meanings.sent1: The company's decision to cut corners resulted in ignominy among its competitors.
meanings.sent2: The general's ignominy was clear when his cowardly actions were exposed.
meanings.sent3: The clown's ignominy at tripping over his own feet brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The ignominy of cheating in the race tarnished the athlete's reputation irreparably.
meanings.sent5: The ignominy of being caught lying left a stain on her character that she couldn't erase.
